name: Risen Sanctuary
text: Vigilance

editions.flavor: When one of the great guardians arises, it sweeps enemies aside like chaff yet takes care not to crush a single insect underfoot.

name: Rise of Eagles
text: Create two 2/2 blue Bird enchantment creature tokens with flying. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

editions.flavor: An offering to the sea brings an insight from the stars.

name: Rise of the Dark Realms
text: Put all creature cards from all graveyards onto the battlefield under your control.

editions.flavor:
"For every living person there are generations of dead. Which realm would you rather rule?"
—Liliana Vess

name: Rise of the Hobgoblins
text:
When Rise of the Hobgoblins enters the battlefield, you may pay {X}. If you do, create X 1/1 red and white Goblin Soldier creature tokens.
{R/W}: Red creatures and white creatures you control gain first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor: A river even the merrow dare not cross.

name: Rise to the Challenge
text: Target creature gets +2/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Plidius wagered that Arissa couldn't kill a chimera with her javelins alone. She proved him wrong in a way everyone could see for days to come.

name: Rishadan Airship
text:
Flying
Rishadan Airship can block only creatures with flying.

editions.flavor: The view is truly spectacular—as long as you don't look at Rishada itself.

name: Rishadan Brigand
text:
Flying
When Rishadan Brigand enters the battlefield, each opponent sacrifices a permanent unless he or she pays {3}.
Rishadan Brigand can block only creatures with flying.

name: Rishadan Cutpurse
text: When Rishadan Cutpurse enters the battlefield, each opponent sacrifices a permanent unless he or she pays {1}.

editions.flavor:
The bigger the purse, the greater the fool.
—Rishadan saying

name: Rishadan Footpad
text: When Rishadan Footpad enters the battlefield, each opponent sacrifices a permanent unless he or she pays {2}.

editions.flavor: "The best things in life are free. Money, for instance."

name: Rishadan Pawnshop
text: {2}, {T}: Shuffle target nontoken permanent you control into its owner's library.

editions.flavor: Everything comes to the waterfront eventually, on the tide or on credit.

name: Rishadan Port
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Tap target land.

editions.flavor: Rishada is the gateway to free trade—but the key will cost you.

name: Rishkar, Peema Renegade
text:
When Rishkar, Peema Renegade enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two target creatures.
Each creature you control with a counter on it has "{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool."

editions.flavor: "Aether is the soul of Kaladesh, and all souls should be free."

name: Rishkar's Expertise
text:
Draw cards equal to the greatest power among creatures you control.
You may cast a card with converted mana cost 5 or less from your hand without paying its mana cost.

editions.flavor: "Control the Great Conduit? You might as well try to divert a river with your hands."

name: Rising Miasma
text:
All creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.
Awaken 3—{5}{B}{B} (If you cast this spell for {5}{B}{B}, also put three +1/+1 counters on target land you control and it becomes a 0/0 Elemental creature with haste. It's still a land.)

name: Rising Waters
text:
Lands don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player untaps a land he or she controls.

editions.flavor: Rising waters, sinking hope.

name: Risky Move
text:
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player gains control of Risky Move.
When you gain control of Risky Move from another player, choose a creature you control and an opponent. Flip a coin. If you lose the flip, that opponent gains control of that creature.

name: Rite of Consumption
text:
As an additional cost to cast Rite of Consumption, sacrifice a creature.
Rite of Consumption deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to target player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.

name: Rite of Flame
text: Add {R}{R} to your mana pool, then add {R} to your mana pool for each card named Rite of Flame in each graveyard.

editions.flavor: Deep beneath the ice, beneath the soil and the rock, Dominaria's fire still burned hot.

name: Rite of Passage
text: Whenever a creature you control is dealt damage, put a +1/+1 counter on it. (The damage is dealt before the counter is put on.)

editions.flavor: Every scar is a lesson, every battle a test of what you have learned.

name: Rite of Replication
text:
Kicker {5} (You may pay an additional {5} as you cast this spell.)
Create a token that's a copy of target creature. If Rite of Replication was kicked, create five of those tokens instead.

name: Rite of Ruin
text: Choose an order for artifacts, creatures, and lands. Each player sacrifices one permanent of the first type, sacrifices two of the second type, then sacrifices three of the third type.

editions.flavor: Skirsdag cultists refused to quietly accept Avacyn's ascendancy.

name: Rite of the Raging Storm
text:
Creatures named Lightning Rager can't attack you or planeswalkers you control.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player creates a 5/1 red Elemental creature token named Lightning Rager. It has trample, haste, and "At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice this creature."

name: Rite of the Serpent
text: Destroy target creature. If that creature had a +1/+1 counter on it, create a 1/1 green Snake creature token.

editions.flavor:
"From your death, new life. From your loss, our profit."
—Kirada, Qarsi overseer

name: Rite of Undoing
text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
Return target nonland permanent you control and target nonland permanent you don't control to their owners' hands.

name: Rites of Flourishing
text:
At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player draws an additional card.
Each player may play an additional land on each of his or her turns.

editions.flavor: "Dance, and bring forth the coil! It is an umbilical to Gaea herself, fattening us with the earth's rich bounty."
"Dance, and bring forth the coil! It is an umbilical to Gaea herself, fattening us with the earth's rich bounty."
"Dance, and bring forth the coil! It is an umbilical to Gaea herself, fattening us with the earth's rich bounty."

name: Rites of Initiation
text: Discard any number of cards at random. Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn for each card discarded this way.

name: Rites of Reaping
text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn. Another target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Don't cross a Devkarin elf unless you long for an early grave.

name: Rites of Refusal
text: Discard any number of cards. Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3} for each card discarded this way.

name: Rites of Spring
text: Discard any number of cards. Search your library for up to that many basic land cards, reveal those cards, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

name: Rith's Attendant
text: {1}, Sacrifice Rith's Attendant: Add {R}{G}{W} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: "Rith is the claw of the ur-dragon, scattering seeds of devastation."

name: Rith's Charm
text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target nonbasic land.
• Create three 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens.
• Prevent all damage a source of your choice would deal this turn.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition

name: Rith's Grove
text:
When Rith's Grove enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return a non-Lair land you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {R}, {G}, or {W} to your mana pool.

name: Rith, the Awakener
text:
Flying
Whenever Rith, the Awakener deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{G}. If you do, choose a color, then create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token for each permanent of that color.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition

name: Rith, the Awakener Avatar
text: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {5}. If you do, put a 5/5 red Dragon creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

editions.flavor: DRB Avatar
Alternative-art Avatar

name: Ritual of Restoration
text: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: Leonin raising ceremonies take place at the white sun's dawn, the rebirth of artifacts mirroring the birth of a new day.

name: Ritual of Steel
text:
Enchant creature
When Ritual of Steel enters the battlefield, draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2.

editions.flavor:
"Our soldiers are blessed with lizard scales as hard and cold as steel."
—Sidar Jabari

name: Ritual of Subdual
text:
Cumulative upkeep {2} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
If a land is tapped for mana, it produces colorless mana instead of any other type.

editions.flavor:
"That which does not bend to the will of Freyalise shall surely break."
—Kolbjörn, elder druid of the Juniper Order

"That which does not bend to the will of Freyalise shall surely break."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

name: Ritual of the Machine
text:
As an additional cost to cast Ritual of the Machine, sacrifice a creature.
Gain control of target nonartifact, nonblack creature.

editions.flavor:
"Rumors persist of dark deeds performed in the depths of Soldev. When will Dagsson heed the danger therein?"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic

"Rumors persist of dark deeds performed in the depths of Soldev. When will Dagsson heed the danger therein?"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

name: Ritual of the Returned
text: Exile target creature card from your graveyard. Create a black Zombie creature token. Its power is equal to that card's power and its toughness is equal to that card's toughness.

editions.flavor: A mask forged to avenge a death forgotten.

name: Rivalry
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, if that player controls more lands than each other player, Rivalry deals 2 damage to him or her.

editions.flavor: The goblins revered it; the viashino defended it. Only Urza understood it.

name: Rivals' Duel
text: Choose two target creatures that share no creature types. Those creatures fight each other. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

editions.flavor: They could agree on one thing only: one of them must die.
They could agree on one thing only: one of them must die.
They could agree on one thing only: one of them must die.

name: Riven Turnbull
text: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: "Political violence is a perfectly legitimate answer to the persecution handed down by dignitaries of the state."
"Political violence is a perfectly legitimate answer to the persecution handed down by dignitaries of the state."

name: River Bear
text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

editions.flavor: The bears had been isolated on an island for hundreds of years, until the island sank and the bears didn't.
The bears had been isolated on an island for hundreds of years, until the island sank and the bears didn't.

name: River Boa
text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
{G}: Regenerate River Boa.

editions.flavor:
"But no one heard the snake's gentle hiss for peace over the elephant's trumpeting of war."
—Afari, Tales

"Sheath your swords! Cudgels only. I see a new pair of waterproof trek boots slithering away."
—Nablus, North Hada trapper

"But no one heard the snake's gentle hiss for peace over the elephant's trumpeting of war."
—Afari, Tales

"But no one heard the snake's gentle hiss for peace over the elephant's trumpeting of war."
—Afari, Tales

"Sheath your swords! Cudgels only. I see a new pair of waterproof trek boots slithering away."
—Nablus, North Hada trapper

"But no one heard the snake's gentle hiss for peace over the elephant's trumpeting of war."
—Afari, Tales

name: River Delta
text:
River Delta doesn't untap during your untap step if it has a depletion counter on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a depletion counter from River Delta.
{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool. Put a depletion counter on River Delta.

name: Riverfall Mimic
text: Whenever you cast a spell that's both blue and red, Riverfall Mimic has base power and toughness 3/3 until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn.

editions.flavor: Mimics don't hide their natural form well, but their disguises work well enough on boggarts.

"Since the war began, fishermen don't sing to the kaijin to ask for full nets. They guard the shore with thrice-blessed spears, saving the nets for their wives to pack their belongings and leave."
—Hayato, master sailor

name: River Kelpie
text:
Whenever River Kelpie or another permanent enters the battlefield from a graveyard, draw a card.
Whenever a player casts a spell from a graveyard, draw a card.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

name: River Merfolk
text: {U}: River Merfolk gains mountainwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

editions.flavor:
"Dwelling in icy mountain streams near goblin and orcish foes, the river merfolk were known for their stoicism."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. V

"Dwelling in icy mountain streams near Goblin and Orcish foes, the River Merfolk were known for their stoicism."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. V

name: River of Tears
text: {T}: Add {U} to your mana pool. If you played a land this turn, add {B} to your mana pool instead.

editions.flavor:
"The Westfolk wept, and their tears wore winding rivers into the cheek of the world."
—Glem the Lonebard, "Origins of Kholon"

name: River's Grasp
text: If {U} was spent to cast River's Grasp, return up to one target creature to its owner's hand. If {B} was spent to cast River's Grasp, target player reveals his or her hand, you choose a nonland card from it, then that player discards that card. (Do both if {U}{B} was spent.)

name: Riverwheel Aerialists
text:
Flying
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

editions.flavor: Adepts of the Riverwheel Stronghold can run through rain and never get wet; masters use the raindrops as stepping stones.

name: Rix Maadi, Dungeon Palace
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{1}{B}{R}, {T}: Each player discards a card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

editions.flavor: Even miles away, if you put your ear to the sewer vents, you can hear the screams and the tempestuous laughter.

name: Rix Maadi Guildmage
text:
{B}{R}: Target blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
{B}{R}: Target player who lost life this turn loses 1 life.

editions.flavor: Insatiable, irresistible, and insane.

name: Roaring Primadox
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, return a creature you control to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor:
"They're easy enough to find. Question is, are you sure you want to find one?"
—Juruk, Kalonian tracker

"They're easy enough to find. Question is, are you sure you want to find one?"
—Juruk, Kalonian tracker

name: Roaring Slagwurm
text: Whenever Roaring Slagwurm attacks, tap all artifacts.

editions.flavor: Wurms compete for nesting grounds near the Radix. The young who hatch closest have the best chance for survival.

name: Roar of Challenge
text:
All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.
Ferocious — That creature gains indestructible until end of turn if you control a creature with power 4 or greater.

name: Roar of Jukai
text:
If you control a Forest, each blocked creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
Splice onto Arcane—An opponent gains 5 life. (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

name: Roar of Reclamation
text: Each player returns all artifact cards from his or her graveyard to the battlefield.

editions.flavor:
"Yesterday's relics will determine the outcome of tomorrow's war."
—Ushanti, leonin seer

name: Roar of the Crowd
text: Choose a creature type. Roar of the Crowd deals damage to target creature or player equal to the number of permanents you control of the chosen type.

editions.flavor: One voice is but a pebble to the rest of the world. A thousand voices at once is an avalanche.

name: Roar of the Kha
text:
Choose one —
• Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
• Untap all creatures you control.
Entwine {1}{W} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

name: Roar of the Wurm
text:
Create a 6/6 green Wurm creature token.
Flashback {3}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Roast
text: Roast deals 5 damage to target creature without flying.

editions.flavor:
"Intruders in the lands of Atarka have but two choices: be consumed by fire, or be consumed by maw."
—Ulnok, Atarka shaman
The wave of lava seared cloth from skin, skin from flesh, and flesh from bone.

name: Robber Fly
text:
Flying
Whenever Robber Fly becomes blocked, defending player discards all the cards in his or her hand, then draws that many cards.

editions.flavor: In pursuit of the juicy fly, Squee stumbled on the hidden hangar.

name: Robe of Mirrors
text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

editions.flavor: "Does this make me look fat?"

"Some say you cannot hit what you cannot see. I prefer that you hit what I want you to see."
—Arcanis the Omnipotent

name: Robot Chicken
text:
Whenever you cast a spell, put a 0/1 colorless Egg artifact creature token onto the battlefield.
Whenever an Egg you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, destroy target artifact or creature.

editions.flavor: Why did the chicken cross the road? To die in the name of science.

name: Roc Egg
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
When Roc Egg dies, create a 3/3 white Bird creature token with flying.

editions.flavor: A thin shell lies between the roc and a world of bite-sized treats.

name: Roc Hatchling
text:
Roc Hatchling enters the battlefield with four shell counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a shell counter from Roc Hatchling.
As long as Roc Hatchling has no shell counters on it, it gets +3/+2 and has flying.

name: Rock Badger
text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

editions.flavor: The Kyren goblins created most of the inverted mountain's tunnels simply by driving the beast before them.

"As it charged our keep, I mistook it for a bear. After it tore through our ramparts and half the guard, I wished it had been a bear after all."
—Ballista guard

name: Rock Basilisk
text: Whenever Rock Basilisk blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

editions.flavor: In the eastern reaches of Jamuraa are arrangements of massive stones. No one knows their origins—for certain.

name: Rockcaster Platoon
text: {4}{G}: Rockcaster Platoon deals 2 damage to each creature with flying and each player.

editions.flavor:
"Aven bandits can be sly. You've got to fill the sky with boulders—and then seek cover immediately."
—Knight-Captain Wyhorn

name: Rocket Launcher
text: {2}: Rocket Launcher deals 1 damage to target creature or player. Destroy Rocket Launcher at the beginning of the next end step. Activate this ability only if you've controlled Rocket Launcher continuously since the beginning of your most recent turn.

editions.flavor: What these devices lacked in subtlety, they made up in strength.
What these devices lacked in subtlety, they made up in strength.

name: Rocket-Powered Turbo Slug
text: Super haste (This may attack the turn before you play it. (You may put this card into play from your hand, tapped and attacking, during your declare attackers step. If you do, you lose the game at the end of your next turn unless you pay this card's mana cost during that turn.))

name: Rock Hydra
text:
Rock Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
For each 1 damage that would be dealt to Rock Hydra, if it has a +1/+1 counter on it, remove a +1/+1 counter from it and prevent that 1 damage.
{R}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Rock Hydra this turn.
{R}{R}{R}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Rock Hydra. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

name: Rock Jockey
text:
You can't cast Rock Jockey if you've played a land this turn.
You can't play lands if you've cast Rock Jockey this turn.

editions.flavor: Goblins don't know much about physics, but they know lots about falling and rocks.

name: Rock Lobster
text: Scissors Lizards cannot attack or block.

editions.flavor: Many take the lobster for granite.

name: Rockshard Elemental
text:
Double strike (This creature deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
Morph {4}{R}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

name: Rock Slide
text: Rock Slide deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target attacking or blocking creatures without flying.

editions.flavor:
"Good ol' rock. Nothing beats rock."
—Rhirhok, goblin archer

name: Rockslide Ambush
text: Rockslide Ambush deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.

name: Rockslide Elemental
text:
First strike
Whenever another creature dies, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Rockslide Elemental.

editions.flavor: On Jund, even the landscape is a deadly hunter. Volcanoes, tar pits, and rock slides seem to prey upon the living.
On Jund, even the landscape is a deadly hunter. Volcanoes, tar pits, and rock slides seem to prey upon the living.

name: Rocky Tar Pit
text:
Rocky Tar Pit enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}, Sacrifice Rocky Tar Pit: Search your library for a Swamp or Mountain card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

name: Roc of Kher Ridges
text: Flying

editions.flavor: We encountered a valley topped with immense boulders and eerie rock formations. Suddenly one of these boulders toppled from its perch and sprouted gargantuan wings, casting a shadow of darkness and sending us fleeing in terror.

name: Rod of Ruin
text: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: The rod is a relic from ancient times . . . cruel, vicious, mean-spirited times.
The good news is it's so simple a goblin could use it. The bad news is it's so simple a goblin could use it.
The rod is a relic from ancient times . . . cruel, vicious, mean-spirited times.

"My masterpiece is complete—and so shall be my triumph."
—Saldrath, master artificer

The rod is a relic from ancient times . . . cruel, vicious, mean-spirited times.

name: Rod of Spanking
text: {2}, {T}: Rod of Spanking deals 1 damage to target player. Then untap Rod of Spanking unless that player says "Thank you, sir. May I have another?"

editions.flavor: Minutes before the campus watch busted pledge week at the Alpha Beta Unlimited house . . .

name: Rofellos
text: Whenever a creature you control dies, draw a card.

editions.flavor: Gerrard's longtime friend and fellow student under the maro-sorcerer Multani, Rofellos is an excellent warrior and excellent company. Though adept at both magic and swordplay, he's far more comfortable with a flagon in his hand and a good companion at his side.

name: Rofellos, Llanowar Emissary
text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool for each Forest you control.

name: Rofellos's Gift
text: Reveal any number of green cards in your hand. Return an enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand for each card revealed this way.

editions.flavor:
"Rise, elf. We are both of Gaea, and thus we are equal."
—Multani, to Rofellos

name: Rogue Elephant
text: When Rogue Elephant enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice a Forest.

editions.flavor:
"When are trees like grass?"
—The One Thousand Questions

name: Rogue Kavu
text: Whenever Rogue Kavu attacks alone, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Every litter of kavu yields one cub that refuses to hunt with the pack.
"I know how this one feels," said Urza. "It's not like others of its kind and has been shunned for its differences."

name: Rogue Refiner
text: When Rogue Refiner enters the battlefield, draw a card and you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).

editions.flavor: "It's natural, it's all around us, and it's there for the taking. Just try and tell me what I'm doing is wrong."

name: Rogue's Gloves
text:
Whenever equipped creature deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

editions.flavor: Professional pilferers prefer proper preparation.

name: Rogue Skycaptain
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a wage counter on Rogue Skycaptain. You may pay {2} for each wage counter on it. If you don't, remove all wage counters from Rogue Skycaptain and an opponent gains control of it.

name: Rogue's Passage
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{4}, {T}: Target creature can't be blocked this turn.

editions.flavor: Rumors quickly spread among thieves about a labyrinth without walls and a prize beyond all measures of worth.
Rumors quickly spread among thieves about a labyrinth without walls and a prize beyond all measures of worth.
Rumors quickly spread among thieves about a labyrinth without walls and a prize beyond all measures of worth.
Rumors quickly spread among thieves about a labyrinth without walls and a prize beyond all measures of worth.

name: Rohgahh of Kher Keep
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {R}{R}{R}. If you don't, tap Rohgahh of Kher Keep and all creatures named Kobolds of Kher Keep, then an opponent gains control of them.
Creatures you control named Kobolds of Kher Keep get +2/+2.

name: Roil Elemental
text:
Flying
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you may gain control of target creature for as long as you control Roil Elemental.

editions.flavor: A vortex that devours everything—even the souls of the living.

name: Roiling Horror
text:
Roiling Horror's power and toughness are each equal to your life total minus the life total of an opponent with the most life.
Suspend X—{X}{B}{B}{B}. X can't be 0. (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {X}{B}{B}{B} and exile it with X time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)
Whenever a time counter is removed from Roiling Horror while it's exiled, target player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

name: Roiling Terrain
text: Destroy target land, then Roiling Terrain deals damage to that land's controller equal to the number of land cards in that player's graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"The trembling lands ruptured, leaving an open door for things from below to emerge."
—Screed of the Mul Daya

name: Roiling Waters
text: Return up to two target creatures your opponents control to their owners' hands. Target player draws two cards.

editions.flavor:
"The Roil may be unpredictable, but it is not uncontrollable."
—Noyan Dar, Tazeem roilmage

name: Roilmage's Trick
text:
Converge — Creatures your opponents control get -X/-0 until end of turn, where X is the number of colors of mana spent to cast Roilmage's Trick.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: Weather on Zendikar is unpredictable—unless you're the one telling it what to do.

name: Roil Spout
text:
Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
Awaken 4—{4}{W}{U} (If you cast this spell for {4}{W}{U}, also put four +1/+1 counters on target land you control and it becomes a 0/0 Elemental creature with haste. It's still a land.)
